content.description: Start on a good ledge with some gritty (very Riggs' Hill-like sharp sandstone). There are sparse footholds. Move your left hand into a smooth chockstone (use it either as a gaston or a finger cam). Then hit a right hand, smooth sloper with a glorious thumb catch. Send up to a juggy ledge, or a bump below it. Finish with an easy topout.
content.location:
Climb to the right of '

Pinched in Mud

; It climbs up a very noticeable seam in the boulder and next to a bush growing out of the boulder.

content.description:
Start on two amazing pinches (more like crimp with thumb catch pinches). This starts as a layback almost because the pinches aren't great to start on with your hips towards the wall. So layback and toe hook the big flake to the left that Dust Pan rides along with crazy, cool reachover with your right hand to a good hold. Finish with an easy topout.

This start really just makes the route.
content.location: This starts to the right of Dust Pan. Ascend straight into the second flake more on around the conglomerate/gravel-y part of the boulder.

content.description:
Start on a wide compression start with both of your hands around angular edges. Have a high foot, reach your right hand into a major jug by a little plant growing in the rock. Be careful not to grab a little higher on a flake, because I do believe that flake will break (I didn't pull on it out of that fear). From there, finish with an easy topout.

There is potential for a lower sit start here (I didn't put time into sending it).
content.location: It is on the short face when you first approach the Mud Pile Boulder from Opal Hill First.

content.description: This starts on an amazing flake that is iron tough! Move up cross handed with your left hand, then hit a right hand gaston in another big flake. Top out straight out.
content.location:
Start on the obvious flake down low, and work up then right. It is to the right of

Mud Slide

, near some boulders on the ground.
